Topic.Title: AMZN could blow up today! This is why.

Message.Msg: yes they are good

2012 Holiday Season To Date vs. Corresponding Days* in 2011 Non-Travel (Retail) Spending Excludes Auctions and Large Corporate Purchases Total U.S. – Home & Work Locations Source: comScore, Inc. Millions ($) 2011 2012 Percent Change November 1-December 16 $31,067 $35,004 13% Thanksgiving Day (Nov. 22) $479 $633 32% Black Friday (Nov. 23) $816 $1,042 28% Thanksgiving Weekend (Nov. 24-25) $1,031 $1,187 15% Cyber Monday (Nov. 26) $1,251 $1,465 17% Green Monday $1,133 $1,275 13% Week of Dec. 10-16 $6,286 $7,019 12% *Corresponding days based on corresponding shopping days (November 3 thru December 18, 2011)
can you believe the people going long into that data point! OUCH

Actually, I can. Comscore has published a more recent figure... 16% increase between 2012 and 2011 holiday season. Last year they published a yoy increase of 15% between the 2011 and 2010 holiday season. AMZN increased sales by 34% between 4q 2011 and 4q 2010. Can they do it again?

Message.Title: amazon cloud goes out again....one day it could be for weeks
Message.Msg: http://www.marketwatch.com/story/netflix-suffers-outage-blames-amazon-wsj-2012-12-24

MasterCard figure is more recent at Dec 23 vs Comscore at Dec 16....and the Comscore number is 13% not 16%. Comscore is an IBM company and the results are based on traffic formulas and click through a not actual dollar monitoring....MasterCard is actual dollar transactions. Not sure why you lied about the figure or date with Comscore, you're either just dumb or desperate......or most probably both.
You're right that Comscore reported a 13% growth rate. This was comparing yoy growth between Nov 1 and Dec 16. The latest number, showing sales between Nov 1 thru Dec 21 shows a 16% growth rate.

By the way... I didn't lie. The latest comscore figure shows a 16% yoy growth rate. As far as being dumb... well if you look at my returns from shorting amzn, I'm afraid you'd conclude I am dumb as I've lost my fair share of $$$. I believe that amzn will fall and, when it does, it will fall quickly. I want to be a sure a I possibly can before I go short again. I hope to be short amzn when it inevitably falls. If amzn doesn't report 25% rev growth, I think that its likely its stock price will fall. I'm just not sure they'll disappoint on rev growth. Are you short now?

Be careful of the methodological differences -- they matter. Despite what the public has been led to believe, revenue growth is NOT the primary profit and cash flow driver for Amazon. There is a more important metric and one which, if you synthesize/reconcile the different reports from ComScore and MasterCard, you'll gain important insight on not just the top line, but bottom line as well... By the way, why would 25% revenue growth be acceptable? Normally, companies must demonstrate increasing revenue growth rates to justify increasing multiples... Beyond that, they must demonstrate best in class revenue growth. You might want to check the Channel Advisor statistics comparing YOY revenue growth for eBay versus Amazon...

Message.Title: amazon is in a secular downturn
Message.Msg: not just a blip on the radar, so don't expect next year or the next to revive things. Any MM who is long is best advised to sell if he wants to save his job.

Topic.Title: I believe, Local Corp/Spreebird can substitute CommerceInterface, when CommerceInterface will no longer service other retail channels and current customers

Message.Msg: Spreebird’s deal ranking technology evaluates a user's location and purchase history to personalize the ranking of great deals on local restaurants, spas and more. "We've simplified our design and added personal deal preferences via deal ranking technology to provide users with faster, easier access to more relevant local deals,” said Malcolm Lewis, senior vice president and general manager, social buying, Local Corporation. "Our deal ranking algorithm offers a better way for local businesses to connect with targeted consumers. By maximizing the chances that a user sees a deal they like at the top of the page, they're more likely to click the ‘Buy’ button – a win-win for both consumers and businesses," said Lewis.

Topic.Title: Hey all of you dieckheadz ..... Merry christmas

Message.Msg: Merry Christmas Sybs. Congrats on your gains this year...

For a 45 day linear MA to move that much on 7 extra data points is almost statistically impossible. You posted 13% and have proven nothing further. And MasterCard actual dollar sampling is far more reliable than Comscore estimates. You should accept data points for what they are, not what you wish ether were. Be rational not emotional.

Put spreads....i trade it mainly short, sometimes long when technically oversold. I believe many MF's may want to show long amzn end year, but very few will see the relative value or potential returns through 2013.

Topic.Title: Hey all of you dieckheadz ..... Merry christmas

Topic.Title: Hate to break it to you pumperz, but Holiday sales are very weak

Message.Msg: Very very very very weak. Sales only up 0.7%--expectations were for better than 3%. And the slowing is now accelerating in the past week or two. January should be down 5% from last year, at least.

Message.Title: the Zoomer
Message.Msg: On course to a 4500 PE. Costs are exploding while sales are growing. They can't put a dent in the PE with sales if costs are moving up more rapidly. this was suppose to be the profit quarter for them to get the PE down. Too late now. If the market continues to focus on the sales you might survive.
